content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
												the first fallout game i played, Fallout 3 incredible main story, awsome side quests, and massive nonlieniar atmosphiric open world make this one of the best games i've ever played. After playing both new vegas and fallout 4, i found that in terms of story, atmosphere ,and side quests, fallout 3 is the clear winner dispite in my opinion not being as overall good as fallout 4 (but still 500x better then new vegas, seriously i have no idea what obsidian was thinking when they implemented ceasars legion or thought that the game had an acceptable main quest.) The only true flaw i find in fallout 3 is the actual writing and dialoge that goes with its incredible story, at times its has that nice simple feel to it that might remind you of dialoge beween saturday morning action cartoons (childish, but at the same time awsome,) other times it just is downright childish and rather lazy (seriously, one of the many ways to kill the main villan is to convince him that he is insane, and he just kills himself, yeah its very hard to pass the speech check, but its still rather silly way to destroy a rather awsome villian.) Overall fallout 3 is a gameing masterpeice, combining rpg elements from the first 2 games with (at the time of its relese) modern fps mechanics to bring a new standard to the fallout franchise, a standard that set the foundation for fallout new vegas and Fallout 4.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 28, 2016
												It has been a while since I have actually sat down for a playthrough, however the times that I have were unforgettable moments. This game admittedly has a fairly short campaign once the player is aware of the certain courses that need to be taken; this does not limit replayablility, however. Although the campaign itself is fairly short and straightforward, the gameplay is a whole separate story. With Hub locations across the map, several factions to join, as well as a myriad of perks to choose from as the game progresses, different quest outcomes based on your responses, and a wealth of quests included in the main campaign, side campaigns, quests in add-on packs, as well as the occasional single side mission.  There was never really a dull moment for me in this game. Occasionally the game will minimize with no hope of re-opening, but I am also running on Windows 10, which is a fairly easy scapegoat at this point.  I only have 73 logged hours, but I have so many uncounted hours within my Xbox playthroughs (I happened to acquire that version for free) and I have fallen in love with the game and franchise.  This game will not disappoint.  I give this game 10 Bobbleheads out of 10.

content:
Posted: September 16, 2016
												Fallout 3 is a wonderful open world game that only realizes it's full potential when heavily modded.  To get to to run properly on Windows 7 x64 without crashing at startup or upon loading a new game I had to:1. Add the following line to the Havok section of the fallout.ini:iNumThreads=22. Install and run FOSE (http://fose.silverlock.org/download/fose_v1_2_beta2.7z) instead of the Fallout exe, and install the New Vegas Anti Crash plugins( it works for Fallout 3 as well as New Vegas, and the Dl link is http://www.nexusmods.com/newvegas/mods/53635/?)The GFWL Disabler (http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout3/mods/1086/?) might also help, and enabling the 4GB flag on the game's executable should reduce crashes if using 2K HD retextures like NeilMB. ENBoost could help as well.For modding the game, a good base to start is: http://wiki.step-project.com/User:Kelmych/Fallout3Improved textures, more weapons, more enemies, better lighting, new houses and companions, more interiors, increased difficulty...It will take at least a day to download and set all of those mods up though.

The pacing is still kind of odd in my opinion, and at some points the game feels very slow, but after playing for a while, I really do enjoy it, and I can't wait to play it again.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
												Honestly, this was my first game in the RPG genera, as I had not played any other RPG type games, and this title was recommended to me by a friend. It took me a long time to get used to it, as I based my videogame experience around the call of duty style, run and gun type action games. I dont know where this game has been all my life. This game consumed so many hours of my life on console, I felt kind of obligated to buy it on steam when I got the chance. It not only introduced me to my first RPG game, but the first game series that I spent countless hours exploring the lore and events. No game since captured my attention and hunger for exploration, role play, and overall immersion. I would recommend any RPG lover like myself at least give this game a try. You'd be doing the genera as a whole a huge disservice if you skip out on this title. Hands down a masterpiece. Hats off to bethesda :)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 23, 2016
												This is my favourite game of all time. I have hundreds of hundreds of hours on this game from both console and when I had it installed as a non Steam game and I will have hundreds of hours more having just reinstalled it through Steam after losing my old version in a new Windows install.This game is pretty broken without some tweaking, but once tweaked it is well worth the effort and I found the DLCs to be enjoyable and a good value. I love the setting in this game and can just happily get lost for hours wondering DC.The game of course really comes into it's own after you've made your tweaks and start to install some of the many hundreds of excellent mods out there for this game, ranging from the smallest changes to huge DLC scale additions. There are a ton of guides and hidden gems to find which will teach you about the best way to tweak the game and install mods and after spending many (or few) boring hours reading and collecting your mods you will see for yourself that it is well, well worth it.This game is better now than it has ever been and a few hours invested in setting it up (I know this sounds horrible*) will really pay off.*You don't have to spend this long if you don't want to but to become really well informed on how to tweak and mod Fallout in an efficient and stable way then it will take this long but it IS worth it as it will completely transform the game in nearly any way you want.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 6, 2015
												Considering the age of this game, there is nothing new, innovative or otherwise interesting that I can say about this game that hasn't been said a million times before, so I'll keep it brief. This game is great. You should play it. Your friends should play it. Everyone you know should play it. Your dog should grow opposable thumbs and learn to play videogames just to play this one game. It's that good. I mean sure, running around a desolate wasteland looking for stuff to do isn't everyone's cup of tea. If you don't pay attention it can be hard to know what you're meant to be doing. It consistently crashes on my computer. It's buggy. But despite all that I'm reccomending the game. Why? Because it's that good. The story's good. The voice acting is a solid 8/10, the environments are lovingly - if drearily - crafted, the combat is well designed and intense, the exploration is genuine, the emotions are deep and the controls are intuitive. If you're on the fence, just get Fallout 3. Or wait until Fallout 4 comes out, then it'll probably be cheaper

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 8, 2015
												I own two copies for PC and one for PS3, hundreds of hours lost through several playthroughs over the years, all of which were worth it.Amazing open ended RPG with endless flavour of choices. You start out in the sealed Vault 101 from the post apocalyptic  where you've lived all your life until your dad, voiced by the amazing Liam Neeson, suddenly ups and leaves the vault into the wasteland. You decide to follow him. Now what you do in the DC wasteland is 100% up to you, have fun. Pros: Main story voice actingInteresting main story lineOpen gameplay optionsEndless of character customizationCharacter ProgressionFun radio system that tracks your actionsModding community keeps the game alive for PCCons:Repetitive minor questsShort DLC questsDLC story plots were a bit weakBecomes relatively easy after a certain point.NOT optimized AT ALL for Windows 7 and up (crashing, freezing, etc)... (can be fixed through tweaks and mods). However I can't fault Bethesda too hard for this, it's an older game and when I hear Microsoft I also hear BSOD by default so give them some slack for this.Pros definitely outweigh the cons, and if you're not afraid of getting your hands dirty with the modding community you can even make this relatively older game seem like a newer release as I feel it's still a fantastic game overall. 9.5/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 22, 2015
												This is without a doubt one of the best RPGs I have ever played, tailing just behind Skyrim. Thought if you have newer (or just relevant) versions of Windows you will have to install some user made content to make the game run, the 30 minutes doing that is absolutely worth it, as this amazing game offers countless hours of content and an amazing open world that you can freely roam and help your fellow survivors. The campaign is the best in the series and is compelling as you play as the Lone Wanderer who leaves his vault and goes out into the wasteland to find his father and finish the goal his parents had created years before. All-in-all this is an amazing game that everyone deserves the chance to try. [CAN'T WAIT FOR FALLOUT 4]

												Tis a purrty nice open world rpg game, the second similar genre i played after skyrim, and honest to say i really loved the apocalyptic wasteland environment area they threw me in, the option of picking between different old fashioned rifle or advanced weaponry and the moral choices you make that affects your karma and such, i liked it. Companions are a thing in this game including a loyal dog that follows you around although the AI might be buggy sometimes and there would be random crashes occuring every now and then it's still an experience considering how old this game already is. This might be close to what would happen if a world war 3 would occur in real life with all the nuclear warfare and such that our neighboring military government is pumping out, hopefully not the case cause id just die on the spot considering how close my home is to some of those controversial countries, a hint: im in Asia, you catch the gist.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 20, 2016
												I have spent much, much more time than indicated on Fallout 3; I often play with mods to help modernize the game a tad, and when I launch it through the mod manager, Steam doesn't log my hours for whatever reason.  I'm not going to write some massive, long review, I only want to say one thing.  The game is just a tad dated, as it did come out in 2009 on engine that was already beginning to show its age.  This doesn't mean it isn't fantastic, though; even without mods it is worth at least one playthrough for sure.The main reason I wrote this review is because yes, the game will not run on Windows 8 or older.  However, fixing it is extremely easy (there are many videos and steam guides to help with this) and shouldn't take longer than fifteen minutes tops, unless you don't know even know how to turn your computer on.  It isn't that hard, and this should not be responsible for dragging down the rating of such a fantastic game!!!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 18
												The best game I have ever played and probably will ever have played, and that is not an exaggerated claim.I have so many lovely things to say about this game. I have bought it, selled it and bought it again---several times. I can not get enough of this game... Uuuh, the love I have for it:') With hundreds, if not thousands, of hours of play time on a large number of playthroughs. The longing for yet another playthrough is still within me---but I'm sick of going through the hassle yet again to get the game to run properly on PC.You have to literally mod the heck out of this game to get it to run smoothly, and that's not at all what I want to do (yet again). I look forward in due course to play a remastered 64bit version, one which would make the game run nearly flawlessly---fixing ~all errors, patching the game, make it as compatible as possible for PC---That's the dream.Please BETHESDA, hear my cry of distress!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												Fallout 3 is a stellar game whose value is not diminished by the years that have passed. The game is tailored to your choices and personal playstyle, has an enormous and incredibly detailed map with endless exploration, a great main plot and plenty of meaningful and deep side quests, realistic AI and cities, more lore than you can handle, and is worth hundreds of hours of playtime. The game is an RPG, adventure, horror, FPS, survival, and open-world game rolled into post-apocalyptic masterpiece. 9.5/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
												An old classic, but still as fun as when it was released; from the backstory to the combat, to the interactions, whether it's the Brotherhood of Steel or the Children of Little Lamplight.I loved every second and played it over and over. Whether you play as someone with good karma, evil, or even keep it neutral, it's always different, and always fun. Megaton or Tenpenny?While it's not as diverse as New Vegas, or as customisable as Fallout 4, it's a place to start. Besides, Fallout 3 is like the origin story for so many characters, and is referenced so many times. It's good to know where they come from, isn't it?
